item.title: 中国黑客瞄准菲律宾总统，窃取军事数据
item.description: 据三位熟知内情的人士透露，中国政府支持的黑客入侵了菲律宾政府行政部门，并在长达数年的行动中窃取了敏感数据。【原文：Chinese-state sponsored hackers penetrated the executive branch of the Philippines government and stole sensitive data as part of a yearslong campaign, according to three people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 美国出现首例死亡病例后的禽流感知识
item.description: 对于流感病毒来说，不完美就是优势。它们会不断变异，产生新的病毒株，挑战免疫系统对抗早期病毒的能力。正因为如此，流感对人类和易受其感染的动物物种（主要是鸟类）构成了终生威胁。【原文：For influenza viruses, imperfection is a strength. They constantly mutate, producing new strains that challenge immune systems primed to fight earlier varieties. That’s what makes flu a life-long threat to humans and the animal species — mainly birds — that are vulnerable to it.】

item.title: 有迹象表明反弹可能已经过头，石油在下跌后趋于平稳
item.description: 石油在六个交易日以来首次下跌后企稳，因为技术指标显示最近的涨势可能已经过头。【原文：Oil steadied after its first drop in six sessions, as technical markers showed the recent rally may have gone too far.】

item.title: 美元暴跌为亚洲货币带来缓和：市场综述
item.description: 在华尔街连续第二天反弹之后，亚洲股市涨跌不一。有报道称，美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普提出的关税计划将被淡化，这缓解了该地区货币的压力。【原文：Asian equities look mixed after Wall Street rallied for a second day. Pressure eased on the region’s currencies after a report that President-elect Donald Trump’s proposed tariff plan will be watered down.】

item.title: 新加坡和马来西亚将敲定建立巨大经济区的协议
item.description: 马来西亚和新加坡两国领导人即将正式签署一项协议，建立一个连接两国边境地区的经济特区，但直接经济利益的前景可能取决于自 2023 年开始谈判以来一再拖延的协议的执行情况。【原文：The leaders of Malaysia and Singapore are set to formalize an agreement establishing a special economic zone linking their two nations’ border region, but the prospects for immediate economic benefits may hinge on implementation of a deal that has seen repeated delays since talks began in 2023.】

item.title: 朱利安尼因阻挠投票站工作人员案件被控藐视法庭
item.description: 鲁道夫-朱利安尼（Rudolph Giuliani）因违反与他在佛罗里达州棕榈滩的公寓有关的法律披露要求而被判藐视法庭，这有可能使他离失去第二处价值数百万美元的住所更近一步，以履行 1.48 亿美元的诽谤判决。【原文：Rudolph Giuliani was held in contempt for violating legal discovery requirements related to his Palm Beach, Florida condominium, potentially putting him one step closer to losing his second multi-million dollar residence to satisfy a $148 million defamation judgment.】

item.title: 三星首席执行官吹捧人工智能冰箱和洗衣机
item.description: 三星电子公司（Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd.）正在加大对消费电子产品人工智能的投资力度，希望通过其在智能手机和电视等小工具领域无处不在的影响力，在人工智能领域占据一席之地。【原文：Samsung Electronics Co. is ramping up investment in artificial intelligence for consumer electronics, betting on its ubiquitous presence in gadgets from smartphones to TVs to help it stake out a spot in the AI arena.】

item.title: 迈克尔-巴尔不想为美联储职位打官司，即使他能赢
item.description: 迈克尔-巴尔（Michael Barr）说，他之所以选择卸任负责监管事务的副主席一职，是因为他认为，即使赢得与即将上任的特朗普政府的斗争，留任对美联储来说也是一种损失。【原文：Michael Barr says his choice to step down from his role as Vice Chair for Supervision came down to the calculus that even winning a fight with the incoming Trump administration to stay would be a loss for the Federal Reserve.】

item.title: 阿波罗、BC Partners 接近完成 56 亿美元的 GFL 环境服务部门交易
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士透露，由阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management Inc.【原文：A consortium backed by Apollo Global Management Inc. and BC Partners is close to acquiring a controlling stake in GFL Environmental Inc.’s environmental services unit, in a deal that could value the business at about C$8 billion ($5.6 billion), including debt, people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: 2025年伊始，石油牛群因特朗普贸易和技术因素而壮大
item.description: 随着技术信号促使算法交易员抛出空头头寸，以及对冲基金为特朗普第二任期内的制裁和通胀做准备，资金经理们越来越看涨2025年开始的石油价格。【原文：Money managers are turning increasingly bullish on oil to start 2025 as technical signals prompt algorithmic traders to dump short positions and hedge funds position for sanctions and inflation in a second Trump term.】

item.title: Meta 的扎克伯格将 UFC 的达纳-怀特和其他两人纳入董事会
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc.选出三名新董事加入董事会，其中包括终极格斗锦标赛首席执行官达纳-怀特（Dana White），他是媒体行业最具影响力的高管之一，也是美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的高调竞选者。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. elected three new directors to its board, including Ultimate Fighting Championship Chief Executive Officer Dana White, one of the media industry’s most influential executives and a high-profile campaigner for US President-elect Donald Trump.】

item.title: 特朗普让世界猜测他打算如何征收关税
item.description: 美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普周一在社交网站上否认了关于他重掌白宫后可能会缓和全面关税计划的报道，这为他即将采取的最受瞩目的政策举措之一带来了不确定性。【原文：President-elect Donald Trump took to Truth Social on Monday to deny a report that he might moderate plans for across-the-board tariffs when he retakes the White House, fanning uncertainty about one of the most hotly anticipated policy moves he’s set to make.】

item.title: 公司蜂拥进入高等级债券市场，这是九月以来最繁忙的一天
item.description: 由于风险溢价持续紧张，周一有近二十多家公司涌入美国高等级债券市场，成为 9 月初以来发行量最大的一天。【原文：Nearly two dozen companies flocked to the US high-grade bond market on Monday, making it the biggest day for issuance since early September as risk premiums stay persistently tight.】

item.title: 卡尼、弗里兰领衔加拿大总理特鲁多继任人选名单
item.description: 贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）周一表示，他将在未来几个月内卸任加拿大总理一职，结束连续三次赢得大选并在该国最高政治职位上任职九年的政治生涯。【原文：Justin Trudeau said Monday that he will leave as Canada’s prime minister in the coming months, ending a political run that included three consecutive election victories and nine years in the country’s highest political office.】

item.title: 石油出口居巴西首位，助力 COP30 东道主应对挑战
item.description: 石油已超过大豆成为巴西的第一大出口产品，这一前所未有的表现凸显了 COP30 东道主作为化石燃料冠军的地位。【原文：Oil has surpassed soybeans as Brazil’s top export, an unprecedented performance that underscores the COP30 host’s status as a fossil-fuel champion.】

item.description: 周一，投资者纷纷涌入美国股市风险最高的角落，给去年表现不佳的股票市场带来了巨大的推动力。【原文：Investors rushed into the riskiest corners of the US stock market Monday giving last year’s laggards a big boost.】

item.title: First Eagle 通过限制退出的多边基金提高收益率
item.description: First Eagle Investments 计划推出一种投资于高收益市政债券的产品，该产品有一个转折点：投资者取款仅限于每年几次。【原文：First Eagle Investments plans to launch a product investing in higher-yielding municipal bonds with a twist: investor withdrawals are limited to a few times per year.】

item.title: 迪尔在中西部农场以外采用无人驾驶技术缓解劳动力紧张问题
item.description: 迪尔公司（Deere & Co.）已经在美国中西部的农田里引入了无人驾驶犁，现在它希望将自动机器引入果园、采石场和草坪，以帮助缓解劳动力市场紧张的局面。【原文：Deere & Co., which has already introduced driverless plows to farm fields in the Midwest, now wants to bring autonomous machines to orchards, quarries and grassy lawns to help ease a tight labor market.】
